zcom.wx.console.command.executable.options

Class MarkedOption<Type>

  • java.lang.Object
    • zcom.wx.console.command.executable.options.MarkedOption<Type>

  • public class MarkedOption<Type>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a marked option. A marked option is an argument of the form:

    cmd -m option

    where m is the marker and option the value of the option.
    Note that a marker can also be alone, as well as it can be followed by several options.

      • markerOnly

        public static MarkedOption<?> markerOnly(java.lang.String... markers)
        Build a marked options with no associated values.

        To test if the user did input or not the marked, use isSet().
        Parameters:
        markers - Any marker that identify this option.
        Returns:
        The built option

      • getValue

        public Type getValue()
        Get the value associated with this argument.
        In the case of an optional argument that the user did not input, this will return null (or default if set).

        This should be used only for single element arguments (where max = 1). Else, use getValues()
        Returns:
        Value associated or null if no value is set

      • getValues

        public java.util.List<Type> getValues()
        Get the list of values associated with this argument.
        If the minimum is 0 and no elements have been input by the user, this will return null (or default if set).

        Returns:
        The list of values associated with this argument
